title: Water Point Functionality - Malawi, 2022
text: dataset contains survey records functionality management rural water points Malawi. information gathered enumerators using mWater application support BASEflow 6 April 2022. primary purpose data collection assess operational status water points, identify technical water quality problems, evaluate seasonal reliability, document community management structures order inform maintenance planning, strengthen water governance, improve access safe sustainable water supply. Potential use cases dataset include: Local governments water authorities plan maintenance, target investments, monitor water service delivery. NGOs development partners identify priority interventions, support vulnerable communities, evaluate effectiveness water governance models. Community water committees service providers strengthen accountability, improve routine monitoring, support timely repairs. Researchers academics study rural water service sustainability, water point performance, governance dynamics. Donors policy makers track progress toward SDG 6 (clean water sanitation) inform evidence-based decision making.

title: Water Point Functionality - Malawi, 2022
code: library(waterpointfunctionality)  # Load necessary libraries library(ggplot2) library(dplyr) library(tidyr)  # 1. Bar chart of functionality status # Purpose: shows the functionality status of the waterpoints   # Count occurrences of each functionality status func_count <- waterpointfunctionality %>%   count(functional_status)  # Bar chart ggplot(func_count, aes(x = functional_status, y = n, fill = functional_status)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   labs(title = "Water Point Functionality Status",        x = "Functionality Status",        y = "Count") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "none") # 2. Bar chart of common problems # Purpose: Shows frequency of common problems with the waterpoints  problems_long <- waterpointfunctionality %>%   separate_rows(current_problem, sep = ",\\s*") %>%   filter(!is.na(current_problem) & current_problem != "NA") %>%   # Remove "Other", "etc", etc.   filter(!tolower(current_problem) %in% c("other", "etc", "other (please specify)"))  # Count frequency of each problem problem_count <- problems_long %>%   count(current_problem) %>%   arrange(desc(n))  # Plot Bar chart ggplot(problem_count, aes(x = reorder(current_problem, n), y = n, fill = current_problem)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   coord_flip() +   labs(title = "Common Problems at Water Points",        x = "Problem Type",        y = "Count") +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "none")

title: Water Point Functionality - Malawi, 2022 — waterpointfunctionality
text: tibble 11409 rows 16 variables submitted_on Date time survey response submitted waterpoint_photo Link file path photo water point latitude Latitude coordinate water point location longitude Longitude coordinate water point location functional_status Operational status water point (eg  functional  partially functional  broken) current_problem Main problem affecting water point other_current_problem additional problems listed current problem water_quality_problems_available Indicates water quality issues observed water point available_water_quality_issues Specific water quality problems observed (eg  turbidity  contamination) other_water_quality_issues water quality issues listed available water quality issues households_using_waterpoint Approximate number households regularly using water point water_unavailable_seasonally Indicates whether water supply affected seasonal variation water_unavailable_period Periods year water available service_provider_available Indicates responsible person organization maintaining water point type_of_provider Type service provider (eg  government  private  community based) waterpoint_committee_active Indicates whether water point active Water Point Committee managing
